results.title: The Miracle of life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sveriges television, Bo G. Erikson and Carl O Lofman
results.brief_description: With the aid of highly magnified internal live photography, medical filmmakers, Lennart Nilsson, Bo Erikson and Carl Lofman, are able to bring to the screen the first filmed sequence of the human ovum undergoing the process of fertilisation - the exact moment when life begins. “The Miracle of Life” then follows the exciting development of the foetus as it prepares to enter the world outside.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sveriges television, Bo G. Erikson and Carl O Lofman

results.title: The Miracle of Humpty Doo
results.brief_description: Describes the success of a rice-growing station in the Northern Territory. The venture, undertaken by the Australian-American Territory Rice Ltd is part of an overall plan to open up large areas of the Territory for the growing of rice, which will find a ready market in Asian countries.

results.title: The Mining town: (Casting the money-lenders from the Temple)
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Australian National Gallery, Malcolm Otton and David Muir
results.brief_description:
Episode number 21 of Series “The Australian eye IV”.
A study of the painting “The Mining town” by Arthur Boyd. Arthur Boyd, as an artist, has developed his own personal imagery to express the universal themes of love and oppression of life and death, regeneration and metamorphosis. The film is centred around one of his most complex allegorical paintings. He speaks of the effect of his upbringing and family background upon the style and content of his work and the influence of Brueghel on his art.

results.title: The Mining and smelting of copper
results.brief_description: Copper is a conductor of electricity used for electrical wiring, prevents rust. Shows copper mining scenes in Arizona, Utah and Montana which produce three-quarters of copper mined in the USA. Also shows mining operations including smelting.

results.title: The Miners of Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Deals with the construction of various types of tunnel for Melbourne’s sewerage and water supply systems. Includes the operation of the mechanical boring machine, the “mole”, used on construction of the South-Eastern Trunk Sewer and on the Thomson scheme.

results.title: The Mind of Nicolas Poussin: the Seven Sacraments
results.creator_credit: Samaritan Films and Dudley Shaw Ashton

results.title: The Mind of man
results.brief_description: A survey of modern research on the mind in various countries of the world. Covers areas of mind development in children, effects of drugs, dreams, brain structure, the brain and sexuality, reasoning, and the power of the mind in controlling bodily functions. Includes interviews with Sir John Eccles, Donald Hebb and B.F. Skinner. Introduced by Magnus Magnusson, commentary by Marius Goring.

results.title: The Mind machines
results.brief_description: Discusses research being done on artificial intelligence, a branch of computer science. Explores possible developments such as computer controlled robots equipped with a sense of vision and the ability to respond flexibly to changing conditions.
